qas.question: How many sexes of annelids were there originally?
What do annelids' larvae live like?
What does the trochophore become when annelids mature?
What releases sperm from annelids eyes?
What do annelid eggs explode inside?
What do annelids' larvae like to eat?
What does the trochophore become when annelids die?

context: It is thought that annelids were originally animals with <a0_0>two<a0_0/> separate sexes, which released ova and sperm into the water via their <a1_0><b5_0>nephridia<b5_0/><a1_0/>. The fertilized eggs develop into <a2_0><b6_0>trochophore larvae<b6_0/><a2_0/>, which live as <a3_0><b7_0>plankton<b7_0/><a3_0/>. Later they sink to the sea-floor and metamorphose into miniature adults: the part of the trochophore between the apical tuft and the prototroch becomes <a4_0><b8_0>the prostomium (head)<b8_0/><a4_0/>; a small area round the trochophore's anus becomes the pygidium (tail-piece); a narrow band immediately in front of that becomes the growth zone that produces new segments; and the rest of the trochophore becomes the peristomium (the segment that contains the mouth).
